blockingIssues.description: validateInput() in packages/cli/src/schema-input.ts (lines 247-254) falls back to returning raw picked flags when schema.safeParse() fails. This means invalid data can reach the .action() handler via the `input` field (packages/cli/src/command.ts:208), violating the feature requirement that .input(schema) provides a validated typed input object. The function should either surface the validation error (e.g., call exitWithError with a ValidationError) or return a Result type so the caller can handle it.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Update library-worker skill to clarify TDD red-phase expectations for type-only features. In this Bun monorepo, type-only imports in tests do not fail at runtime, and package tsconfig excludes test files from typecheck. Workers should be told that for type-only features, the 'red' phase can be demonstrated by showing a typecheck failure in a non-test file that imports the not-yet-existing type, rather than requiring a failing runtime test.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: Session 4a76a3e6 (os-337-hint-types) transcript shows tests passed with `import type` before implementation, and package typecheck still passed because tests are excluded from tsconfig. Worker handoff skillFeedback.suggestedChanges called out this exact gap.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Update library-worker skill export verification guidance to account for monorepo/type-only export realities. Current guidance leads workers to attempt `bun -e` imports from repo root which fail for subpath exports and type-only modules. Guidance should reference .factory/library/user-testing.md which documents using package-directory-relative verification instead.
